intro: Calendula sancta, commonly known as holy flower or sacred marigold, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright orange to yellow petals and dark brown central disk. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom from late spring to early autumn, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value and medicinal properties. Calendula sancta is also used in traditional herbal remedies for its anti-inflammatory and antiseptic qualities.
